div.p: I hope that this email finds you well. We miss our students and connection with all of you. Our COVID-19 team continues to meet almost daily and as always, we want to keep you updated on new information and processes as they become known.

p.span: The North Clackamas School District (NCSD) has compiled strategies and educational activities that families can use to keep students engaged in learning during this school closure.

Remote learning activities are organized by grade level and contain a combination of low tech and technology-based options across multiple subject areas, including consideration for student physical and mental wellness. English Language Development (ELD) options are also included.

div.a: Would You Like To Volunteer With Us?

div.p: Make a difference! Help students succeed.

The North Clackamas School District values its volunteers. Our school volunteers support student success by sharing their skills, ideas, and knowledge. From helping out in the classroom, to providing career planning assistance, volunteers are welcome at all of our schools.

a.title: Would You Like To Volunteer With Us?

div.p: With the passage of the Student Success Act (SSA), North Clackamas Schools (NCSD) has been gathering feedback from our community, students, and staff to determine how to invest approximately $11-13 million in annual state funding.

Engagement efforts to this point have focused the conversation on what NCSD is doing well and where we need to improve. The district must use engagement feedback and student academic data to select Strategic Areas found to be the most urgent within our community to meet the purposes of these funds.

With input from students, staff employee associations, district administrative team, state legislators, parents and community advocates, the North Clackamas School District Board of Directors approved the 2019-2020 Legislative Agenda.
The 2019-2020 Legislative Agenda can be found below.
Want to help support the school district's legislative interests?

img.alt: Student Success Act; Student Investment Account

div.p: The NCSD School Board voted unanimously at its April 9 meeting to officially suspend the search for a new Superintendent and accept Matt Utterback’s offer to defer his retirement plans for another year. The Board extended their appreciation to Mr. Utterback for providing consistent leadership during this time of uncertainty and unprecedented community need.
